body_html: tf.layers.Dense is the name of a class (capitalized means class in Python conventions), and so calling tf.layers.Dense is creating an object, which is what Asim is referring to as the object-oriented layers API. I think there are already some examples using them, and more on the way, @asimshankar and @fchollet would know more.

body: tf.layers.Dense is the name of a class (capitalized means class in Python conventions), and so calling tf.layers.Dense is creating an object, which is what Asim is referring to as the object-oriented layers API. I think there are already some examples using them, and more on the way, @asimshankar and @fchollet would know more.
